title: FF! Doc | RegExPipe
paragraphs: https://regex101.com can be used to quickly create and debug regex expressions.
listItems: Required Support a current transaction; create a new one if none exists.
Supports Support a current transaction; execute non-transactionally if none exists.
Mandatory Support a current transaction; throw an exception if no current transaction exists.
RequiresNew Create a new transaction, suspending the current transaction if one exists.
NotSupported Do not support a current transaction; rather always execute non-transactionally.
Never Do not support a current transaction; throw an exception if a current transaction exists.
codeBlocks:
<RegExPipe name="regExPipe" regex="^(.*?)(name!)$" flags="CASE_INSENSITIVE">
 		<Forward name="then" path="EXIT" />
 		<Forward name="else" path="EXIT" />
 	</RegExPipe>

<RegExPipe name="regExPipe" regex="^(.*?)(name!)$" flags="CASE_INSENSITIVE">
 		<Forward name="then" path="EXIT" />
 		<Forward name="else" path="EXIT" />
 	</RegExPipe>

RegExPipe

Tries to match the input against the provided regex.
<RegExPipe name="regExPipe" regex="^(.*?)(name!)$" flags="CASE_INSENSITIVE">
 		<Forward name="then" path="EXIT" />
 		<Forward name="else" path="EXIT" />
 	</RegExPipe>

Input:

Hello name!

Output:

<matches>
 		<match index="1" value="Hello name!">
 			<group index="1">Hello </group>
 			<group index="2">name!</group>
 		</match>
  </matches>

https://regex101.com can be used to quickly create and debug regex expressions.

See also
Github - RegExPipe Implementation Examples
Javadoc - org.frankframework.pipes.RegExPipe
Syntax
Copy
<RegExPipe name="" regex=""/>
Attributes
Required
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
regex	text	-
The regex expression to match against the input.
name	text	-
The fun
